title: Substitutes for Red Cabbage and Scallions

items.name: Red cabbage -> Green cabbage
items.details: Closest match. Slightly milder and paler but works well raw or sauteed.

items.name: Red cabbage -> Napa cabbage
items.details: Softer, sweeter, and wilts faster. Good for stir-fries or when you want less crunch.

items.name: Red cabbage -> Kale (thinly sliced)
items.details: Heavier and earthier, but works in cooked dishes.

items.name: Red cabbage -> Shredded carrots
items.details: Adds color and crunch. Not the same flavor but works in a pinch.

items.name: Scallions -> Chives
items.details: Closest flavor match for raw use, though milder.

items.name: Scallions -> Shallots or red onion (thinly sliced)
items.details: More pungent, use sparingly or quick-pickle to mellow.

items.name: Scallions -> Leeks (light green/white part)
items.details: Milder onion flavor, better cooked than raw.

items.name: Scallions -> Garlic chives
items.details: Great substitute with a slightly more garlicky note.

notes: Also covered: ground pork does not take longer to cook than ground beef or turkey in a skillet. All cook in roughly 6-8 minutes over medium-high heat. Ground pork and beef: 160F internal temp. Ground turkey: 165F and may take slightly longer since it is leaner.
